articles.title: Indiana's unemployment rate rises by 0.1% in March | Northwest Indiana Business Headlines - nwitimes.com
articles.description: Indiana's unemployment rate rises by 0.1% in March | Northwest Indiana Business Headlines nwitimes.com Indiana's unemployment rate ticked up to 3.6% in March, from 3.5% in both January and February.
articles.content:
Indiana's unemployment rate ticked up to 3.6% in March, from 3.5% in both January and February.
Private sector employment grew by 5,300 workers statewide as compared to February and is up by 38,100 over the past year, according to the Indiana Department of W… [+1355 chars]

articles.title: I’ve Seen Goldman Sachs From the Inside. We Need Public Banks.
articles.description: We need to move away from the Wall Street model of banking, which privatizes profit while socializing harm. The post I’ve Seen Goldman Sachs From the Inside. We Need Public Banks. appeared first on Truthout.
articles.content: For far too long, Wall Street has wreaked havoc on people’s personal financial stability and our economy as a whole. I should know. As a managing director at Goldman Sachs in the early 2000s, I witnessed firsthand how the banking industry lined their pockets … [+4628 chars]

articles.title: American Atlantis
articles.description: In the new book America Before: The Key to Earth’s Lost Civilization, author Graham Hancock looks for traces of a lost Ice Age civilization in the Americas. Despite relying on controversial research and drawing extreme conclusions, his hunt still comes up sho…

articles.title: 3M plays big role in U.S. effort to bolster ranks of women inventors
articles.description: Congress and others look to company for solutions to "lost Marie Curies."

articles.author: Mike Hughlett
articles.title: Technology, cost could hamper efforts for 100 percent carbon-free grid in Minnesota by 2050
articles.description: Gov. Tim Walz wants Minnesota's electric power to be completely green energy by 2050. How to reach that goal remains a puzzle.
articles.content:
By midcentury, coal and natural gas could be erased from Minnesotas electricity grid, replaced by carbon-free power sources, particularly wind and solar.
That is the goal of Gov. Tim Walz, who is pushing legislation for a totally clean grid by 2050. Ditto fo… [+9999 chars]
